reviews.review_msg: Lots of reading, perhaps a bit much for a 100 level class, but if you can't write a 1 page summary on the readings, then don't take the class.  Participate in class, no matter what side you are on, address everyone by their name and you will do fine in this class.  Oh yeah, and we got to pick all the questions for the final how easy is that?

Great Teacher.  he is def different than all other teachers i have had.. he doesnt make you recite what he teaches and he tells you that.  He wants you to think outside of the box, debate, and get angry. Lots of reading tho, 1-2 papers (1 page) due every class.  no tests.. pretty easy A
BEST CLASS DISCUSSIONS!!!! he keeps everyone interested and makes class a good experience. Do not serf the web during class though...he gets ANGRY
If you don't like reading then DO NOT take this class.  I am required to read about 5 times as much as any of my other classes.  Once again, If your not an AVID reader you will be kicking yourself!!
Salm is a wonderful teacher. He cares about his student and takes the time to know your name. There is a lot of reading, but its relitivly easy. Particpate in class and you will get an A.
Correction**the first three comments ever made about him that were of poor rating are totally not accurate**

The first three comments are not an accurate depiction of Salm. I am a student who does not like reading that much, however, when I took this class Salm made me an avid  reader and researcher. His classes are fun and interesting-discussions are open to friendly debate. Take Salm and you will not regret it!

Take Salm!U will not be disappointed!He always treated us w/ respect.Discussions are awesome!Participate cuz u get the most out of it.He always encouraged us to push our knowledge, read&research beyond, and learn more each class.He makes class fun!Reading is a must!Study for tests they can be tricky.A is attainable if u participate and read.A+prof!

By far my favorite class at ASU. Salm has a passion for social justice that is contagious. He gives equal time to all sides of issues talked about in class. Tests are fair, books are easy, and discussions keep the class interesting. Class participation is essential, but it is easy to get involved. Take this class with Salm, it's 100% worth it!

This class was a good class, but he is very unorganized and he doesn't always tell you accurate information.  Although, gives very good study guides, you have weekly quizzes, and exams are only 25 questions long.  So it's very easy to get an A.  Over all -- good class with a bit of confusion.

He is very confusing, and if you like organization, this is not the class for you.  He is always chaning things around and creating new assignments, nothing is formal.  Very unprofessional.  Debates can be fun, but only when you are talking about something that the class gets involved with, otherwise, boring.
